statements: Laws concerning abortion should aim to balance respect for developing fetal life with protection of the pregnant person’s health, autonomy, and equal participation in society. While people disagree about when moral status begins, many can agree on policies that reduce unintended pregnancies through education and contraception, ensure timely care in cases of serious health risk, rape, incest, or severe fetal anomalies, and support informed, non-coerced decision-making. Any legal limits should be evidence-based, allow reasonable access early in pregnancy, include clear medical exceptions, and be paired with robust prenatal, postpartum, and social supports so fewer people face pregnancy under crisis conditions.
